ags:resource.dc:title: Toxicity of Acanthus ilicifolius (L) Fractions Against Pratylechus spp. on Maize (Zea mays)

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Pollution problems associated with the control of plant parasitic nematodes, necessitated research into alternative nematode management methods. The roots of Acanthus ilicifolius were evaluated for its phytochemical constituents and nematicidal activity. Methanol and n-hexane extracts of A. ilicifolius roots were chromatographed on silica gel column (100-120Î¼m mesh grades). Six fractions were tested on Pratylenchus spp infecting maize in the field. Generally enhanced plant development was observed in the treated plants. The polar fractions were significantly (P
